title: How I program with LLMs
dot:
digraph LLM_Programming{rankdir=TB;node[shape=rectangle, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];title[label="How I Program with LLMs
2025-01-06", shape=plaintext, style=bold]; subgraph cluster_summary{label="Summary";style=dashed;background[label="Background", shape=plaintext, style=bold];experience[label="Personal Experiences"];productivity[label="Net-positive on Productivity"];tool[label="Building Tools for Go
(sketch.dev)"];curiosity[label="Curiosity about New Technology"]; background->experience;experience->productivity;experience->tool;curiosity->background;} subgraph cluster_methods{label="Methods of Using LLMs";style=dashed;autocomplete[label="Autocomplete"];search[label="Search"];chat[label="Chat-driven Programming"]; autocomplete->search;search->chat;} subgraph cluster_chat{label="Chat-driven Programming";style=dashed;motivation[label="Motivation for Chat"];exam_style[label="Exam-style Questions"];error_handling[label="Tooling Error Handling"]; motivation->exam_style;exam_style->error_handling;} subgraph cluster_tests{label="Code and Tests";style=dashed;structure[label="Code Structure"];tests[label="Better Tests"];examples[label="Examples
(e.g., Reservoir Sampler)"];error_fix[label="Error Correction via LLM"]; structure->tests;tests->examples;examples->error_fix;} subgraph cluster_future{label="Future Directions";style=dashed;less_dry[label="Less DRY Code"];specialized_code[label="More Specialized Code"];sketch_dev[label="Automating with sketch.dev"]; less_dry->specialized_code;specialized_code->sketch_dev;} title->cluster_summary;title->cluster_methods;title->cluster_chat;title->cluster_tests;title->cluster_future;}

title: Show HN: Tramway SDK – The Unholy Union Between Half-Life and Morrowind Engines
dot:
digraph tramway_sdk{graph[rankdir=LR, splines=true, nodesep=0.7] node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Arial", fontsize=12, fixedsize=true, width=3, height=1.2] TramwaySDK[label="Tramway SDK", shape=ellipse, width=2.5, height=1.5, fontcolor=white, style=filled, fillcolor="#4C7A95"] SystemReqs[label="Unreasonable System Requirements
(Turbobloat)", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]SystemReqsTurbobloat[label="Turbobloat: Unity & Godot need
powerful hardware", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]SystemReqsTramway[label="Tramway SDK can run on
15 year old hardware", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]SystemReqsSoftwareRasterization[label="No Graphics Card needed - uses
software rasterization", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]SystemReqsBenefit[label="Affordability, Reduced e-Waste", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]Nodes[label="Nodes are Bad", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]NodesIssue[label="Nodes require back-and-forth
between GUI and code", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]NodesTramway[label="Tramway SDK uses direct C++
sublassing, no nodes", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]Monolithism[label="Monolithic Game Editors", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]MonolithismIssue[label="Wait time for unnecessary features
to load in engines", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]MonolithismTramway[label="Tramway SDK offers optional editors,
only use needed tools", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]MonolithismData[label="Data can be edited manually as text files", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]Graphics[label="Graphics", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]GraphicsIssue[label="Unity games often look bad
even with advanced shaders", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]GraphicsTramway[label="Tramway SDK can produce high quality
rendering on older hardware", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]QuakeEditors[label="Quake Level Editors", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]QuakeEditorsTramway[label="Brush-based level creation,
converts to triangle meshes", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]RPGFramework[label="Framework for RPGs", fillcolor="#f2b3b3", style=filled]RPGFrameworkTramway[label="RPG Framework similar to
RPG Maker, supports open-world", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]TLDR[label="TL;DR", shape=ellipse, width=3, height=1.5, fontcolor=white, style=filled, fillcolor="#4C7A95"]TLDRContent[label="Tramway SDK supports lowpoly games,
level streaming, and custom editors", fillcolor="#d1e7d3", style=filled]TramwaySDK->SystemReqs TramwaySDK->Nodes TramwaySDK->Monolithism TramwaySDK->Graphics TramwaySDK->QuakeEditors TramwaySDK->RPGFramework TramwaySDK->TLDR SystemReqs->SystemReqsTurbobloat SystemReqs->SystemReqsTramway SystemReqs->SystemReqsSoftwareRasterization SystemReqs->SystemReqsBenefit Nodes->NodesIssue Nodes->NodesTramway Monolithism->MonolithismIssue Monolithism->MonolithismTramway Monolithism->MonolithismData Graphics->GraphicsIssue Graphics->GraphicsTramway QuakeEditors->QuakeEditorsTramway RPGFramework->RPGFrameworkTramway TLDR->TLDRContent}

title: Zig's comptime is bonkers good
dot:
digraph ZigComptime{node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontsize=12, fontname="Helvetica", width=1.8];title[label="Main Idea: Zig's Comptime Metaprogramming" shape=plaintext fontsize=16 style=dotted]intro[label="Programming power through automated data manipulation.
Metaprogramming: code treated as data.
Zig’s comptime enables compile-time execution for efficiency.
Multiple views offer different perspectives on comptime.
This is a practical guide to Zig's powerful comptime." shape=box width=2.5];view0[label="View 0: You Can Ignore It
Efficient, mixed runtime and comptime
No overhead, code remains readable and debuggable" shape=box style=filled fillcolor=lightgray width=2.5];view1[label="View 1: Generics
Use comptime for type genericity
Flexible functions & structs using types at compile time" shape=box style=filled fillcolor=lightblue width=2.5];view2[label="View 2: Standard Code, Run at Compile Time
Run typical code at compile time (e.g., FizzBuzz optimization)
Precompute values, improve efficiency" shape=box style=filled fillcolor=lightgreen width=2.5];view3[label="View 3: Partial Evaluation
Substitute known values at compile time
Optimize code, simplify repetitive tasks" shape=box style=filled fillcolor=lightyellow width=2.5];view4[label="View 4: Comptime Evaluation
Evaluate statements at compile time
Emit runtime code only for unknowns" shape=box style=filled fillcolor=lightcoral width=2.5];view5[label="View 5: Textual Code Generation
Generate source code dynamically at compile time
Powerful metaprogramming tool" shape=box style=filled fillcolor=lightpink width=2.5];conclusion[label="Conclusion
Comptime enables powerful metaprogramming in Zig.
Flexible approaches: from generics to code generation.
Highly efficient and readable code with minimal overhead." shape=box width=2.5];intro->view0[label="Introduction to Comptime" dir=none];view0->view1[label="Entry Point to Generics" dir=none];view1->view2[label="FizzBuzz Example Optimization" dir=none];view2->view3[label="Partial Evaluation" dir=none];view3->view4[label="Compile-Time Runtime Emission" dir=none];view4->view5[label="Code Generation" dir=none];view5->conclusion[label="Summary and Final Thoughts" dir=none];edge[fontsize=10, fontname="Helvetica", arrowsize=0.5];rankdir=LR;}
